sections.summary: The 'Stop and Reverse' system. It is a trailing stop-loss indicator designed to lock in profits. It assumes the market is always trending. When the dots flip, you flip your position.
sections.deep_dive: The SAR dots appear below price in an uptrend and above price in a downtrend. As the trend accelerates, the dots accelerate (parabolic curve), tightening the stop-loss to protect gains.
sections.council_debate: {"geopolitics": "In war or crisis, markets move vertically. SAR is the BEST indicator for catching vertical moves because it accelerates with price. It keeps you in the trade during the panic pump/dump.", "macro": "SAR works terribly in macro consolidation periods (e.g., waiting for Fed minutes). It will chop you to pieces. sections.forecast_risks: Whipsaws in sideways markets. The SAR will constantly flip buy/sell in a range, generating 10 small losses in a row. It ONLY works in strong trends.
sections.gms_conclusion: The ultimate 'Let Winners Run' tool. Never move your stop-loss away from the SAR dots. Let the market take you out.
